title: The 2am goat (and why I now ask clarifying questions)
excerpt: Some nights are quiet. Other nights… you’re negotiating with a goat in a cul-de-sac.

content.text: It started like any sleepy airport drop: low chatter, soft radio, empty streets.
Then came the bleat. Passenger door opens, in hops a very polite goat. No warning.
Ask if riders have ‘companions’—human or otherwise—before you roll.

items: Keep a towel in the trunk.
Have a firm ‘no farm animals’ policy ready.
Laugh about it later; screenshot the 5⭐ if you earned it.

title: Game day near Notre Dame: survive and profit
excerpt: Stadium surge looks good until you’re stuck. Here’s how to make money without frying your nerves.

content.text: Surge bait is real. If you can’t move, you’re not earning.

items: Stage near exits, not the stadium gates.
Walk pickup to the rider when safe—send the pin, avoid the gridlock.
Set a personal floor for long pickups.

content.text: After the 3rd quarter, head to the hotel belt. Departures beat arrivals.

title: The aux cord ‘music tax’ debate
excerpt: Charging a buck to play DJ? Kidding… mostly. Here’s my playbook for music vibes that keep ratings high.

content.text: Silence beats bad tunes. But the right soundtrack changes tips.

items: Default: chill playlists at a low volume.
Offer 2–3 genre buttons riders can pick quickly.
Keep an emergency ‘no lyrics’ set for 5am airport runs.

content.text: For your sanity, block explicit tracks before weekend bar close.
